intro: Tetraria daenikeri, commonly known as the yellow tetraria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tetraria daenikeri is considered a species of conservation concern.
